answers.answer: Hello,Patients with diabetes can get headaches from blood sugars dropping too low or climbing too high. Other than that it can be due to tension headache as well. If eating anything causes headaches then it can be due to migraine headaches as well.It is very difficult to precisely confirm a diagnosis without examination and investigations and the answer is based on the medical information provided. For exact diagnosis, you are requested to consult your doctor. I sincerely hope that helps. Take care and please do keep me posted on how you are doing.

question: I have type 2 for 12 yrs now, and I have been running highs to 500 for this long, I notice that when ever I eat anything, my sugars jump to the moon,, I was told I am a sensitive diabetic and I am on an insulin pump pushing the highest amount given in the pump. was on meds they just took me off of all of them. Now I notice that was sleeping and I woke to a quick snap in my head that woke me right away, and now the top of my head hurts very tender and sore.. I don't know if this is from having high sugars, and hitting the lows here lately.
title: Diabetic
